metadata.title: CVE-2021-36690 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - negligible
metadata.description:
** DISPUTED ** A segmentation fault can occur in the sqlite3.execommand-line component of SQLite 3.36.0 via the idxGetTableInfo functionwhen there is a crafted SQL query. NOTE: the vendor disputes the relevanceof this report because a sqlite3.exe user already has full privileges(e.g., is intentionally allowed to execute commands). This report does NOTimply any problem in the SQLite library.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-36690` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lemon - 3.31.1-4ubuntu0.3
libsqlite3-0 - 3.31.1-4ubuntu0.3
libsqlite3-tcl - 3.31.1-4ubuntu0.3
sqlite3 - 3.31.1-4ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sqlite3 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.31.1-4ubuntu0.3').
